item.title: America's Business is Jobs, Not College
item.description: Many of us are guilty. I am, too. You, probably. In high school (and after) we mocked the kids who took shop. The “greasers” who got credit for wrenching on cars or welding or making cabinets. It was the 1980s and shop, along with home economics, became an elective in most schools. Until the 80s, some practical life skill class was a requirement at most American public and parochial high schools.
